fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.histories

Class IncrementallyInterpolatedFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.histories.IncrementallyInterpolatedFunction

  • public class IncrementallyInterpolatedFunction
extends java.lang.Object
    The class IncrementallyInterpolatedFunction implements a piecewise defined functions over successive intervals where each piece is interpolated using an interpolator generator (creating an appropriate interpolating function for each) and which can be extended with new pieces at the end of its current domain by adding points.

    Description

    Interpolator generators can be either unconstrained, with only beginning and ending points defined, or they can be constrained by known first order derivatives for each point.

    This class need not be thread safe, as each of its instance will be owned by one and only one ValueHistory instance and its reference will be confined within this ValueHistory instance. Hence, ensuring the thread safe property is left to the class ValueHistory.

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2021-12-07

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

        public void addPoint(double x,
                     double t)
        add a new point in the function following the last piece; the function is not really defined until at least two points have been given.

        Contract

         pre     !isConstrainedInterpolation()
 pre     isEmpty() || after(t)
 post    !(isEmpty()_pre && !hasFirstValue()_pre) || hasFirstValue()
 post    !(isEmpty()_pre && hasFirstValue()_pre) || (!hasFirstValue() && !isEmpty()
 post  isEmpty() || in(t)
        Parameters:
        x - new value for f(t).
        t - time coordinate of f.

      • add

        protected void add(Interval inter,
                   PolynomialI poly)
        add a new piece following immediately the last piece in this interpolated function.

        Contract

         pre     inter != null && poly != null
 pre     this.pieces.isEmpty() ||inter.followsImmediately(this.pieces.lastElement().interval)
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        inter - the interval of definition of the new piece.
        poly - the polynomial defined over this interval.

      • findPiece

        protected Piece findPiece(double t)
        find the piece in which the parameter t is; if t is before the existing pieces, return the first piece and if t is after the existing pieces, return the last piece.

        Contract

         pre     !isEmpty()
 post    ret != null
 post    !(before(t) || after(t)) || ret.in(t)
 post    !before(t) || ret.before(t)
 post    !after(t) || ret.after(t)
        Parameters:
        t - parameter which evaluation piece must be found.
        Returns:
        the piece in which t is or the first piece if t is before all pieces or the last piece if t is after all pieces.
